This page provides an overview of the resources produced by our lab, including code tutorials and tools to support analysis, openly available data products for research and exploration, recordings of talks and presentations by lab members and collaborators, and demonstration videos that showcase our methods and findings. 

# üõ†Ô∏è Code

::: {.callout title="Biodiversity Intactness Index (BII) tutorial"}
[The BII tutorial](https://adrianadepalma.github.io/BII_tutorial/) gives an example of how to model and project the BII using a subset of the PREDICTS (Projecting Responses of Ecological Diversity in Changing Terrestrial Systems) data.
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: {.callout title="predictsr R package"}
The `predictsr` package retrieves PREDICTS project datasets openly available on the Natural History Museum Data Portal, specifically from the 2016 and 2022 data releases. Available on CRAN: [predictsr](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/predictsr/index.html)
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# üìä Data

::: {.callout title="Biodiversity Intactness Index (BII) data"}
Explore country, region, and global-level BII summaries from 1970 to 2050, under various scenarios, available [here](https://data.nhm.ac.uk/dataset/bii-bte).
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: {.callout title="PREDICTS project data releases"}
The PREDICTS (Projecting Responses of Ecological Diversity in Changing Terrestrial Systems) project provides open access data on terrestrial biodiversity responses to land-use change. The data is available on the Natural History Museum Data Portal:

-   [2016 data release](https://data.nhm.ac.uk/dataset/the-2016-release-of-the-predicts-database-v1-1)
-   [2022 data release](https://data.nhm.ac.uk/dataset/release-of-data-added-to-the-predicts-database-november-2022)
:::
